title: Being close to my Promos to Diamond V made me think
body:
Should I even be climbing any higher?
Once I win these next three games I won't be Metal anymore...

replies.body:

diamonds are fragile. If you were to hit a diamond with a hammer hard enough the hammer could break it. The thing about diamonds being so hard is mainly in its ability to be scratched. Breaking on the other hand is much different.

Hardness is a rather difficult-to-define mechanical property. Different hardness standards would end up having pretty different evaluations of a material's hardness. Toughness, on the other hand, is simply a measure of the energy absorbed to fracture per unit volume. Diamond, lacking a plastic deformation phase, has very low toughness, it cannot absorb a lot of energy before it fractures. However, its high Young's Modulus means that the **static force** required to fracture is very high.
That's what it says in the post and the fact that tidal was talking about Masters which seems to be made of metal
Exactly
{{champion:44}} The gems beckon you. Do not ignore them.

Diamonds are forged in extreme heat and extreme pressure.

Diamonds are made of carbon.

Carbon is found in all living creatures.

Carbon is a key ingredient for making steel.

So a Diamond is the carcass of a dead creature forced into extreme heat and pressure, to be dug up and infused into Mordes Metal.  So that he can create more carcasses. 

How is that not malicious, or metal enough for you to progress?
This post fills me with Determination.

Glad to help.

https://www.wired.com/images_blogs/rawfile/2013/03/Hansoloprofilethumb-660x833.jpg
Then strive to become Malicious Master

This is more than likely the best course of action. While being Metal does seem very crucial to being loyal to The Iron Revenant, it should also be known that he is also a Master of all who oppose him, controlling their worthless souls like pawns. That is a true Mordekaiser, not one who is made of Metal, but one who can bend those to his grip.

Of course, it's all up to your preference. It's also to note that the terms "Maven" and "Master" seem to highly resemble each other....

Shaclone says Platinum is the best. He says Diamond is full of dumb people who act like they were boosted there but couldn't climb any higher. Then there's fraction of good people in high Diamond and in Master and Challenger If they weren't boosted. But he says most people who can tryhard, who have good team cooperation and listen well to ping-calls are in Platinum.

BUT, he used to be Master and fell down to Diamond and got demoted to Diamond III the moment he said it and was really pissed about it, so I took what he said with a bag full of salt and a little overview. I'm far from there so I don't know by experience I can only interpret what he said.

But I'm pretty sure there's lot of Diamondees there who will tell you better what's it like in those circles.

PS: And I know you meant it as joke but had the feel to just tell this. Don't even know why I should have said that :D I just had writing urgue.
So on the non-serious note - try to change your main to Taric for Dia, Yi for Master and Xin for Challenger and it'll be fine.

> [{quoted}](name=Malicious Metal,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=wcPuH3Z5,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-06-20T10:40:18.249+0000)

> Should I even be climbing any higher?
> Once I win these next three games I won&#039;t be Metal anymore...

Diamond is a whole new experience. Diamond 5 is where all the washed-out diamond players go. Lots of toxic

Diamond 4-3 is full of good players who make mistakes often

Diamond 2+ is some of the best ranked games ive ever played. Very competitive

At Diamond 5, it becomes an even bigger ELO hell than plat was. A lot of people got boosted to diamond 5. Now I am not saying it's like 90%. It's just when most people get boosted the ideal rank is prob diamond. Then on top of that, you just got those players who have hit their skill ceiling and has to improve a lot in order to climb again. The disparity in skill becomes more and more clear as you get to higher diamond as players in game make less and less mistakes. All of a sudden those squishy champs feel tanky because everyone is dodging each other's abilities and juking each other nonstop. Sometimes you won't get a kill until like 30 minutes in or there will be like 30 deaths. You just don't know. You will start seeing those LCS plays and jukes almost every game.
Diamond players have clown fiestas all the fucking time.
That's some deep shit.
